title: Senior Business Manager (Technology/Digital)
content:
About Ogilvy
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry. 
Ogilvy Indonesia's Experience Team is on the lookout for a Senior Technology Business (Technology/Digital) to join our team.
About Experience Team:

Ogilvy Experience is a technology-focused business that delivers solutions on CRM, Commerce, Martech, Data, and AI.
We best in class technology focused solutions across CX, CRM, Data, Commerce, MarTech and AI to the biggest clients in Indonesia.
Ogilvy Experience infuses a brand’s unique emotional connection into every experience by working at the intersection of customers, data, technology, and brand, creating experiences that transform businesses.
Ogilvy Experience's goal is to make brands matter by designing the brand, turning the brand into an experience, and communicating the brand's story.

Who the right candidate is:

10 to 12 years + work experience in areas of Business Development in Technology company, technology-start up
Possess significant expertise in driving sales in at least one complex specialty / functional area (MarTech, CX, Commerce, Platform Builds, AI, CRM), as well as broad knowledge and skills in others.
Leverage your technology expertise to develop relationships and expand business opportunities.
Skilled public speaker and presenter. Able to address audiences at any level in areas of MarTech, CX, Commerce, Platform Builds, AI, CRM
Skilled at executive level communicator that has addressed strategic and technology operational concerns.
Highly effective and impactful written communication skills to address the most complex technology-based projects and programs
Are viewed as a trusted technical advisor.
Able to influence and inspire action.

What the resposibilities for this role will be:

Manage one or many teams across multiple clients and accounts, drive and facilitate Technology led program decisions
Define engagement deliverables and participate in the review to ensure quality and consistency across Ogilvy Technology engagements.
Validate the accurate estimation of work effort of all resources on an engagement developed by the Technical Project Management Team
Become the primary interface for the engagement at the executive management level (CTO, CDO, Digital Lead, Commerce Lead, CRM Lead etc.)
Manages billings and collections for existing technology business as well for the new business pipeline
Performs strategic account management and planning for Ogilvy’s Technology business clients
Qualify opportunities based on Ogilvy technology offerings and an understanding of client business issues.
Lead sales presentations and marketing activities. Develop and / or finalizes engagement letters, contracts, and MSAs.
Track business technology revenue, pipeline and opportunities

How We’ll Support You 
Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. We’ll empower you with the tools you’ll need to succeed. We’ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. We’ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you’ll be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.  
 


At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
